Name: Chain Mail
Description: Made of interlocking metal rings, chain mail includes a layer of quilted fabric worn underneath the mail to prevent chafing and to cushion the impact of blows. The suit includes gauntlets.

Name: Shield
Description: A shield is made from wood or metal and is carried in one hand. Wielding a shield increases your Armor Class by 2. You can benefit from only one shield at a time.

Name: Leather Armor
Description: The breastplate and shoulder protectors of this armor are made of leather that has been stiffened by being boiled in oil. The rest of the armor is made of softer and more flexible materials.

Name: Scale Mail
Description: This armor consists of a coat and leggings (and perhaps a separate skirt) of leather covered with overlapping pieces of metal, much like the scales of a fish. The suit includes gauntlets.

Name: Handaxe
Description: A light axe designed for one-handed use.

Name: Quarterstaff
Description: A simple wooden staff, often used as a walking stick or weapon.

Name: Mace
Description: A simple weapon with a heavy head on a handle.

Name: Rapier
Description: A thin, light sword with a sharp point, designed for thrusting attacks.

Name: Shortsword
Description: A short, light sword designed for quick strikes.

Name: Shortbow
Description: A small bow designed for short-range combat.

Name: Longbow
Description: A large bow designed for long-range combat.

Name: Light Crossbow
Description: A small crossbow that fires bolts.

Name: Scimitar
Description: A curved sword with a single sharp edge.

Name: Greataxe
Description: A large, two-handed axe designed for powerful strikes.

Name: Staff
Description: A simple wooden staff.

Name: Martial Weapon
Description: A placeholder for a choice of martial weapon. This will be resolved during character creation.

Name: Component Pouch
Description: A small, watertight leather belt pouch that has compartments to hold all the material components and other special items you need to cast your spells, except for those components that have a specific cost (as indicated in a spell's description).

Name: Spellbook
Description: Essential for wizards, a spellbook is a leather-bound tome with 100 blank vellum pages suitable for recording spells.

Name: Holy Symbol
Description: A holy symbol is a representation of a god or pantheon. It might be an amulet depicting a symbol representing a deity, the same symbol carefully engraved or inlaid as an emblem on a shield, or a tiny box holding a fragment of a sacred relic.

Name: Druidic Focus
Description: A druidic focus might be a sprig of mistletoe or holly, a wand or scepter made of yew or another special wood, a staff drawn whole out of a living tree, or a totem object incorporating feathers, fur, bones, and teeth from sacred animals.

Name: Dungeoneer's Pack
Description: Includes a backpack, a crowbar, a hammer, 10 pitons, 10 torches, a tinderbox, a waterskin, and 10 days of rations.

Name: Scholar's Pack
Description: Includes a backpack, a book of lore, a bottle of ink, an ink pen, 10 sheets of parchment, a little bag of sand, and a small knife.

Name: Priest's Pack
Description: Includes a backpack, a blanket, 10 candles, a tinderbox, an alms box, 2 blocks of incense, a censer, vestments, 2 days of rations, and a waterskin.

Name: Burglar's Pack
Description: Includes a backpack, a bag of 1,000 ball bearings, 10 feet of string, a bell, 5 candles, a crowbar, a hammer, 10 pitons, a hooded lantern, 2 flasks of oil, 5 days of rations, a tinderbox, and a waterskin. The pack also has 50 feet of hempen rope strapped to the side of it.

Name: Diplomat's Pack
Description: Includes a chest, 2 cases for maps and scrolls, a fine clothes outfit, a bottle of ink, an ink pen, a lamp, 2 flasks of oil, 5 sheets of parchment, a vial of perfume, sealing wax, and soap.

Name: Explorer's Pack
Description: Includes a backpack, a bedroll, a mess kit, a tinderbox, 10 torches, 10 days of rations, and a waterskin. The pack also has 50 feet of hempen rope strapped to the side of it.

Name: Prayer Book
Description: A book containing prayers and religious texts.

Name: Incense
Description: Fragrant material used in religious ceremonies.

Name: Vestments
Description: Religious clothing worn during ceremonies.

Name: Common Clothes
Description: Simple, everyday clothing suitable for common folk.

Name: Dark Common Clothes
Description: Common clothes in dark colors, suitable for blending into shadows.

Name: Crowbar
Description: Using a crowbar grants advantage to Strength checks where the crowbar's leverage can be applied.

Name: Artisan's Tools
Description: A set of tools used by artisans. The specific type varies by profession.

Name: Shovel
Description: A tool for digging.

Name: Iron Pot
Description: A sturdy iron cooking pot.

Name: Fine Clothes
Description: Elegant clothing suitable for nobility and formal occasions.

Name: Signet Ring
Description: A ring bearing a family seal or coat of arms.

Name: Scroll of Pedigree
Description: A document proving noble lineage.

Name: Purse
Description: A small bag for carrying coins.

Name: Bottle of Black Ink
Description: A small bottle of black ink for writing.

Name: Quill
Description: A writing implement made from a feather.

Name: Small Knife
Description: A small utility knife.

Name: Letter from a Dead Colleague
Description: A letter from a deceased colleague, possibly containing important information.

Name: Insignia of Rank
Description: A badge or symbol indicating military rank.

Name: Trophy from Fallen Enemy
Description: A memento taken from a defeated enemy.

Name: Set of Bone Dice
Description: A set of dice made from bone, used for games of chance.

Name: Scroll Case
Description: A cylindrical leather case for holding scrolls.

Name: Winter Blanket
Description: A warm blanket suitable for cold weather.

Name: Herbalism Kit
Description: This kit contains a variety of instruments such as clippers, mortar and pestle, and pouches and vials used by herbalists to create remedies and potions.

Name: Musical Instrument
Description: A musical instrument. The specific type varies.

Name: Costume
Description: A theatrical costume for performances.

Name: Pouch
Description: A small leather pouch for carrying small items.

Name: Letter of Introduction from Guild
Description: A letter introducing the bearer as a member of a guild.

Name: Traveler's Clothes
Description: Sturdy clothing suitable for long journeys.

Name: Hunting Trap
Description: When you use your action to set it, this trap forms a saw-toothed steel ring that snaps shut when a creature steps on a pressure plate in the center. The trap is affixed by a heavy chain to an immobile object, such as a tree or a spike driven into the ground.

Name: Trophy from Animal
Description: A memento from a hunted animal.

Name: Disguise Kit
Description: This pouch of cosmetics, hair dye, and small props lets you create disguises that change your physical appearance.

Name: Tools of the Con
Description: Various items used to facilitate confidence tricks and scams.

Name: Belaying Pin
Description: A wooden or metal pin used on ships to secure ropes.

Name: 50 feet of Silk Rope
Description: Rope, whether made of hemp or silk, has 2 hit points and can be burst with a DC 17 Strength check.

Name: Lucky Charm
Description: A small trinket believed to bring good luck.

Name: Lute
Description: A stringed musical instrument.

Name: 10 gp
Description: Ten gold pieces.

Name: 15 gp
Description: Fifteen gold pieces.

Name: 25 gp
Description: Twenty-five gold pieces.

Name: 5 gp
Description: Five gold pieces.
